metadata.title: The Old Man and the Sea
metadata.author: Ernest Hemingway

exposition.rationale: Establishes Santiago's character as an unlucky fisherman, his relationship with the boy Manolin, and the Cuban fishing village setting. Introduces his 84-day streak without catching a fish and sets up his determination to break this unlucky streak.

rising_action.rationale: Santiago hooks the great marlin and begins the epic struggle, traveling far out to sea while the fish pulls his skiff. The tension builds through their multi-day battle as Santiago fights exhaustion, cramps, and the massive fish's strength.

climax.rationale: Santiago successfully harpoons and kills the enormous marlin after their prolonged struggle. This represents the peak moment of triumph when he finally overcomes his greatest challenge and proves his skill as a fisherman.

falling_action.rationale: Sharks attack the dead marlin tied to Santiago's boat, systematically destroying his prize catch despite his desperate attempts to fight them off. The consequences of his victory begin to unfold as his triumph is gradually stripped away.

resolution.rationale: Santiago returns to harbor with only the marlin's skeleton, exhausted and defeated yet somehow triumphant. His reunion with Manolin and the tourists' misunderstanding of the fish's remains provide thematic closure about dignity, endurance, and the nature of victory and defeat.

voice.pov_description: Third person limited, focused through Santiago's consciousness and memories
voice.focalization_description: Internal focalization through Santiago's perspective, accessing his thoughts and memories of past strength

structure.plot_architecture_description: Episodic structure presenting a contained memory/flashback of the arm wrestling match

rhetoric.alignment_type_description: Narrative and rhetorical elements work together to establish Santiago's past glory and current decline through focused memory

device_mediation.description: High device mediation through symbolic imagery (shadows, light), repetitive structure, and metaphorical language that transforms a simple arm wrestling memory into a meditation on strength, dignity, and the passage of time

micro_devices.name: Metaphor
micro_devices.definition: An implicit comparison between unlike things that reveals deeper meaning
micro_devices.pedagogical_function: Creates symbolic meaning by comparing abstract concepts to concrete images

examples.quote_snippet: The negro's shadow was huge and it moved on the wall
he had unleashed his effort

micro_devices.name: Symbolism
micro_devices.definition: Objects or actions that represent deeper abstract meanings
micro_devices.pedagogical_function: Embeds thematic meaning within concrete narrative elements

examples.quote_snippet: elbows on a chalk line on the table
Blood came out from under the fingernails

micro_devices.name: Personification
micro_devices.definition: Giving human qualities to non-human things
micro_devices.pedagogical_function: Makes abstract forces feel alive and threatening or helpful

examples.quote_snippet: the lamps threw their shadows against them
as the breeze moved the lamps

micro_devices.name: Repetition
micro_devices.definition: Repeating words, phrases, or structures for emphasis
micro_devices.pedagogical_function: Creates rhythm and emphasizes important ideas through repetition

examples.quote_snippet: and people went in and out of the room
the bettors went in and out

micro_devices.name: Juxtaposition
micro_devices.definition: Placing contrasting elements side by side to highlight differences
micro_devices.pedagogical_function: Creates tension by showing opposites that reveal deeper meanings

examples.quote_snippet: bright blue and were of wood
asking that it be called a draw

micro_devices.name: Dramatic Irony
micro_devices.definition: When readers know something characters don't, creating tension
micro_devices.pedagogical_function: Creates suspense by letting readers see what characters cannot

examples.quote_snippet: He was sure then that he had the negro beaten
won it quite easily since he had broken the confidence

micro_devices.name: Third-Person Limited
micro_devices.definition: Narration focused through one character's perspective and knowledge
micro_devices.pedagogical_function: Creates intimacy while maintaining objective distance

examples.quote_snippet: he had looked at the arm and hand of the negro
He was sure then that he had the negro beaten

micro_devices.name: Flashback
micro_devices.definition: Interruption to show past events that inform the present
micro_devices.pedagogical_function: Provides background information that explains current situations

examples.quote_snippet: They had gone one day and one night
For a long time after that everyone had called him The Champion

micro_devices.name: Scene
micro_devices.pedagogical_function: Slows down time to show important moments in detail

examples.quote_snippet: forced the hand of the negro down and down until it rested
they looked each other in the eye

micro_devices.name: Direct Characterization
micro_devices.definition: Narrator directly tells us about a character's qualities
micro_devices.pedagogical_function: Gives clear information about what characters are like

examples.quote_snippet: the negro, who was a fine man and a great athlete
Santiago El Campeón

micro_devices.name: Imagery
micro_devices.definition: Vivid descriptive language that appeals to the senses
micro_devices.pedagogical_function: Creates mental pictures that make scenes feel real and immediate

examples.quote_snippet: walls were painted bright blue and were of wood
Blood came out from under the fingernails

micro_devices.name: Parallelism
micro_devices.definition: Similar grammatical structures used for emphasis and rhythm
micro_devices.pedagogical_function: Creates rhythm and emphasizes connections between ideas

examples.quote_snippet: their forearms straight up and their hands gripped tight
down and down until it rested

micro_devices.name: Motif
micro_devices.definition: A recurring element that develops theme through repetition
micro_devices.pedagogical_function: Builds meaning through repeated images or ideas

examples.quote_snippet: at their hands and forearms
forced the hand of the negro down

micro_devices.name: Summary
micro_devices.definition: Compressed narration covering longer periods quickly
micro_devices.pedagogical_function: Speeds up time to cover background or less important events

examples.quote_snippet: For a long time after that everyone had called him The Champion
he had won it quite easily

micro_devices.name: Foreshadowing
micro_devices.definition: Hints about future events that create anticipation
micro_devices.pedagogical_function: Builds suspense and connects early events to later outcomes

examples.quote_snippet: one day and one night
He was sure then that he had the negro beaten
